intro: Achras sessiliflora, commonly known as the African silver tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and large, palmate leaves that are typically 30–50 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by yellow, fleshy fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. The African silver tree is valued for its ornamental appearance and ability to withstand drought conditions.
